website_summaries.verdict: Extremely powerful battery leaf blower that delivers up to 125 MPH of air power.
pros: Runs quieter than some other leaf blowers, measured at 60 decibels
Includes a battery with the kit
Battery life is up to 70 minutes per charge
ft. of air per minute, outperforming most battery leaf blowers
cons: Some questions about longevity of the blower

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of the good reviews I read. However, I am severely disappointed in this product and Greenworks customer support (if you want to call it that). The battery will not charge at all so I've had a useless product from day one, contacted service via email since phone support took way too long to pick up. It's been over five days since I have gotten a response to the information they asked for. I will be taking advantage of Amazon's return policy on this item because their service is incredible poor.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a Christmas gift. They used for first time last week......April 22, 2018. Bought the big battery to get the longer operation time. Best they got was 15 minutes on full charge. Decent blower when it is running but unexceptable to have to charge every 15 minutes. Just noticed manufacturing date......Amazon sent us a product that had been produce 3 years prior......will look to get money back.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg

customer_reviews.title: HORRIFIC TIME GETTING REPLACEMENT PARTS WITH NASTY SERVICE
customer_reviews.text: I need a trimmer with access to replacement parts. I have tried in the past to get multiple spools so I can pre-wind several and have them ready. The spool head sets used to be sold at Lowes using the Kobalt label. Now attempts to find any of the entire sets (spools alone are not sold - can you imagine?) are wasting time big time, including Greenworks itself. Anyway I hung up from Greenworks another time here in the months of service and each time I am completely exasperated at the horrendous service and invasive data mining of Greenworks. If one cannot find replacement parts or extra parts, the trimmer is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the gas powered weedeater and the corded blower we had! Starts up so easy my 11 year old can do it and stays charged long enough to get our front and back yard done. The blower is super powerful ! Will never go back to gas !
customer_reviews.author: mhoelzer2988

customer_reviews.title: its a shame since the blower was fantastic for the first month or so on a full ...
customer_reviews.text: battery charger kills the battery. batteries are expensive. this kills this tool. its a shame since the blower was fantastic for the first month or so on a full charge. i have 2 batteries and both are only holding a half charge... should have stuck with a gas unit... green works if your reading this leease please send me 2 new batteries and a fixed charger...
customer_reviews.author: Pope of Leonia

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: The trimmer is a real treat. Multi-speed, bump feed, LOTS of power, and can be configured for a 16-inch cutting diameter. While I would have liked the updated blower (had I known about it at the time), this one still gets the job done with plenty of blowing power and an easy design to handle. The blower and trimmer are both on the heavier side, as in your arms will grow to get used to it, but your arms may end up shaky after the first two lawn jobs. Overall, they are both well built, the battery system makes things easy, and I don't miss gasoline equivalents in the slightest.
customer_reviews.author: SavedByGrace

customer_reviews.title: Second-year still going great
customer_reviews.text: Used it for 2 days and so far I love it. Has plenty of speed although the battery does die quicker at Max. It moves leaves even piles of leaves with ease. I also have the lawn mower and the two together are awesome. I would recommend getting two batteries so one can charge while working with the other. It only takes about a half hour to full charge. Would highly recommend any Greenworks product. Update: second season with the blower and I love it even more. Having two batteries is the way to go. This thing moves leaves like nobody's business. Then I pop a battery into the GreenWorks mower and mow. Highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Larson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in October 2015 to use on my side walk to blow leaves away from my front door. It worked great for a year and then in November of 2016 I went to use it and although the battery is fully charged it won't register any power on the handle and it won't start. It has only been used for this light task so it seems a little extreme that it only lasted a year. I am so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: carribean traveler

customer_reviews.title: Almost equivalent to a medium duty gas trimmer, but one major quirk.
customer_reviews.text: Runs well, but every time you let off of the "throttle" you have to wait a second for it to ramp up to speed again, even if it's still spinning. You can't "goose" it like you would with a gas powered trimmer. -1 star here. Weight and balance is as good as any gas trimmer, maybe a little lighter. The gears & bearings in the head are also getting noisy after light use. Adding grease didn't help. -1 more star. All in all, it's a decent, medium-duty trimmer. If it was lost or stolen (batteries and all), I'd replace it with a stihl FS70R and go back to dealing with gas and oil.
customer_reviews.author: bigj231

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 11 months of light home use
customer_reviews.text: This was a decent blower, had enough power, but the battery life is short. Sub 20 minutes on high. I hope you like the sound of an error beep because you will hear it a lot if you own this. After 11 months of light home use this thing is dead. Battery is fully charged and the unit error beeps and doesn't run. Greenworks claims 4 year warranty, but I haven't had a response from their warranty department. I'm learning that warranty claims are not high on their priority list.
customer_reviews.author: BH

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a year
customer_reviews.text: This blower was great until it stopped working. We maybe used it once or twice a month during the year we've owned it. Greenworks hasn't responded when we try to contact them through email. We know it's not the battery because we also own the mower, weed trimmer and bush trimmers that we interchange 2 batteries with. We wish we could have a full working set of lawn tools.
customer_reviews.author: Kassie's

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended !!!
customer_reviews.text: Greenworks 80v string timmer and blower are excellent, light weight and as powerful as gas powered equivalent models. I recommend having at least two batteries to be able to keep going if you have an excessive amount of work, but the 2ah batteries last around 45mins or more depending on how much continuous running you have. You don't have to have the unit running all the time. I've purchased the mower, the hedge trimmer the string trimmer and the blower if they fail and don't live up to expectations I will amend this review..
customer_reviews.author: donhop02

customer_reviews.title: Get it!
customer_reviews.text: Fired the yard guys. I'm having a blast doing it myself now! Easy peasy equipment, and no gas. It's a little heavy after a while so I purchased a cheap strap that works great.
customer_reviews.author: Savitri

customer_reviews.title: Simply revolutionary line of 80V cordless electric outdoor equipment - extremely pleased!
customer_reviews.text: This is another fantastic product from GreenWorks for their 80V Pro line. When I bought my first home a year ago, I tried out a couple different cordless electric brands and the 80V system from GreenWorks is simply revolutionary. This product line has allowed me to achieve my goal of going gas less for all of my outdoor needs, and I live in MA! I have the lawnmower, snowblower, leaf blower, this trimmer, and the chainsaw and all work extremely well. I highly recommend you try out any of the GreenWorks Pro line of products that you are considering for purchase. Their phone service is very good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Russo

customer_reviews.title: Big time powerful!!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Greenworks 80V string trimmer, and then a month or so later, this blower. Both are amazing. I have 2.5 acres of country yard, this includes a long driveway, concrete porch, back deck. I use the string trimmer first, and most times one battery does the job (unless I trim around the barn and pasture). Sometimes I use some of the second battery to finish my trimming. Then, I use the blower. I've never run out of battery when using the blower, even if I used some of that battery for my trimmer. All to say, lots of power and run time. I like the variable speeds. You can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: EMcB

customer_reviews.title: Has the power you need, and reliable
customer_reviews.text: You can't ask for much else in a hand held blower. You'll want ear protection when using high setting but that's expected. I use it all day for my lawn business. The only thing I don't like is that it's hard to keep it from falling on it's side on the ground because the base is narrow. If you need high power for extended use I suggest using the 4ah or larger batteries. The 2ah will noticeably lose power in the last half of charge due to voltage sag. I've been using it for about 6 months nearly full time job (30-90minutes a day), it's been very reliable so far.
customer_reviews.author: velo781

customer_reviews.title: WHAT? It STOPPED WORKING!
customer_reviews.text: My new toy. It was all about speed and convenience. Got to use this $300 blower LESS than 5 times. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? No way in hell I'm paying a ton of money for a POS that doesn't work. Cut the grass yesterday. Blew off the clippings. Died. Greenworks Pro has been on the "RAPID" charger for the past 18 hours and ZERO! No juice. NO POWER. Somebody better be jumping through hoops to get this thing to work...or, you haven't heard the last from me. PJ Lavelle, Carmel, IN
customer_reviews.author: the Peej

customer_reviews.title: Great String Trimmer...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased anGreenworks Pro electric lawn mower and it is fantastic. So, we figured we'd try the string trimmer. It uses the same battery. The string trimmer does not lack power and you'd think it was gas powered. The good part is that it accepts Ryobi edger and blower. Both Ryobi attachments work great! No gas, no fumes, no filters, and no maintenance! Gas powered products do not work any better. As for the weight, it does not bother me. But my wife thinks it's a little heavy. The trimmer does come with a shoulder strap that makes it easy for my wife. Me? I don't need or use the strap. All is good!
customer_reviews.author: Bum Man

customer_reviews.title: The union to secure attachments is a problem
customer_reviews.text: The 80v motor is great when using attachments from gas devices (pole chainsaw, hedge shears, etc). Electric is much safer - starts slowly and quickly gets up to speed. I can work from a ladder without problem. The main issue is the "green" thumbscrew and clamp does not tighten well (the nut is not captive and must be held with pliers, ie. the connection is not secure. ) I swapped the Greenworks clamp with my Echo pole saw's "orange" clamp. It was a perfect substitution, and the Echo's (with orange thumbscrew) is a much stronger connection.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L

customer_reviews.title: Exhausting.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this along with the mower and hedge trimmer... BOY! This thing gets HEAVY with the 80v battery in it. It works completely fine but your arms will be tired for the next day or two. Also it is a bit too awkward to handle if you're using it to trim your edges as you're most likely relying on the shoulder strap to hold this bad boy up. Unless you got some good upper body strength, you might want to take a hard pass on this one. Battery life on all the products in this 80v line is amazing though with the 4.0ah battery that came with my mower.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Not a good start!
customer_reviews.text: Got my string trimmer today and assembled it only to find that the holes in the head had not been threaded! There was no way to use the screws that came with unit to attach the guard. That's right 4 un-threaded holes that were too small to fit the provided screws into. I was damned if I'd spend the time and energy to return it, so I just found four bolts small enough and long enough to use along with lock washers and nuts. Looks like crap but it will work just fine. How do you make a manufacturing mistake like that, and how many other units with this problem did they send out?
customer_reviews.author: Marv and Peggy

customer_reviews.title: Hearty, great replacement for gas trimmer
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I bought a Stihl trimmer. It lasted 7 years. Years ago I bought a Greenworks blower 80V. It has also lasted and lasted over multiple years of blowing tons of leaves and dust and everything you can imagine. So i sold the Stihl trimmer and bought this Greenworks trimmer, which is lighter than the FC 100RX Stihl trimmer but not as light as the smaller yard trimmers out there. This Greenworks is a beast! It does the same job and I imagine it will last another 7 years on our property. I'm a little concerned about the line head feeding....I hope it holds-up. I do not know yet.
customer_reviews.author: FetvusForTheRestuvus

customer_reviews.title: Power
customer_reviews.text: Don't be fooled by battery powered tools. This trimmer lives up to the power of a gas driven engine trimmer cutting straight through thick and tough areas. The attachments are wonderful help as well as I've purchased the additional pole saw for those hard to reach branches. I have highly recommended this product and will continue to stand behind the 80v series by Greenworks. Battery life is not a problem to cut my entire yard with a standard battery.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and convenient
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a gas backpack blower and a small battery powered trimmer. The blower is awesome with more power than my gas blower and infinity more convenient. I’m still getting used to the trimmer. Because it’s so powerful, unlike my old trimmer where I could see the spinning string, the hardest thing is trying to see where the string will make contact. I’ve already inadvertently made some huge divots but I’ll eventually get the hand of it. Battery has plenty of juice for both trimming and blowing front and rear yards. No if only my lawn mower would die...
customer_reviews.author: DVAB

customer_reviews.title: Good blowing power, battery so-so, ergonomics- wrist fatigue!
customer_reviews.text: Blowing ability- 4.5 stars! Really handy to have good power in a cordless. Battery life- 3 stars. Initially got 30 min. on high setting, varying throttle med to high. Over the week though, it seemed to reduce power. If constantly on high/full throttle, it would either force itself down to low throttle or turn itself off. Had the wait 5-10 min for it to come back on. Got a charge error a few times on the charger, too. Ergonomics- 1 star. With the handle parallel to the blower body, I'd have to hold it in such a way to point the blower down. Wrist fatigue! Returned to try another.
customer_reviews.author: Kent S. Leech

customer_reviews.title: the ONLY 1 downside I noticed after like 2 mins of use was the 80v 4
customer_reviews.text: Ok this blower on its weakest setting destroys my last cordless blower!! its quite, Its got 3 very POWERFUL settings. the most powerful can push a brick!! the ONLY 1 downside I noticed after like 2 mins of use was the 80v 4.0ah battery i use makes the back very heavy and you constantly have to push the front down with your thumb which IS NOT fun. After a few mins I had to switch hands and even after that I had to hold with 2 hands maybe it'll get easier. but a strap could help this but they need to Counter balance the Weight!!
customer_reviews.author: OOa007

customer_reviews.title: used it twice.  Head blew apart.  No Customer service.
customer_reviews.text: Literally used this twice. The line would not advance. I touched it to the ground and the head blew apart. There are no instructions for reassembling the head. I tried customer service twice and was put on hold for 1/2 hour. This was after trying to address it with the manual or find an answer on UTube. This is junk. Waste of my time and $$.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: ... trimmer to replace my ST80L210 model which I absolutely loved. I thought attachment capability would be a great ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trimmer to replace my ST80L210 model which I absolutely loved. I thought attachment capability would be a great add-on too. However, I am terribly disappointed. The power head is noisy (hollow whirring sound that makes me question it durability), it vibrates, and heats up. The power seems to rev when the trimmer is being used. Hard to use at any power level other than full power. The lock-out button often does not release. After multiple attempts at starting, I pull the battery and put it back in and try again with some success. Is anyone else having similar problems? I do like the larger guard on this model.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Avoid This Unit
customer_reviews.text: Arrived unassembled, damaged. Seemed to have been previously sold and returned - arm of unit was bent where someone had attempted to assemble the trimmer and bent the connection. It had some sort of outdoor debris on the head of the trimmer. Battery is too weak for use to do any work beyond 20-30 minutes. Battery is also heavy making the trimmer back heavy and hard to use. I'll go back to either a gas powered unit or even an electric unit before I'd use this one. Returning for refund.
customer_reviews.author: ND Irish Fan

customer_reviews.title: Worst customer service experience in several years
customer_reviews.text: Been trying unsuccessfully to get any kind of product support, several auto replies but no substantive response yet received. Will be sending this, a battery, a charger and a mower back if I dont hear from someone soon on why the trimming head washer and spacer immediately fall off the trimmer once it ramps up to speed. Have reaffixed them multiple times at various degrees of tightness. Any help other than directing me to email you (have several times to NO avail) or to call (the away message literally says you wont take calls and to email you instead) would be helpful
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Died within 3 months
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing blower, until it wasn't. All of a sudden one day it would turn on and then as soon as I pulled the trigger to make it blow, it would die. We barely used it. Maybe 5-6 times tops before it just quit working. It does the same thing with the trimmer so it is obviously a battery issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: bad bump head string trimmer
customer_reviews.text: With a 4 AH battery this thing is heavy. Got this today. opened the box and discovered it was NOT compatible with the pivot head I installed on my greenworks string trimmer Model # 21142. Very disappointed. Every bump head string trimmer I ever owned gave me trouble. This one was not exception. The head malfunctioned half way thru trimming my lawn. the feed mechanism allowed all the string in one side of the spool to wind out all over my yard. very disappointed. Will aske to return this thing. No pivot head compatibly no sale to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bioburner

customer_reviews.title: Strong but very uncomfortable on the hand.
customer_reviews.text: This product works well and is quiet compared to my gas leaf blower. However it has one fatal flaw, terrible balance. It has a heavy large battery hanging off the back, and a very light front end. This results in my hand being in extreme discomfort almost immediately as I try to keep the thing pointing in the correct direction. It's much less comfortable than my gas unit that weighs 2x as much. What an incredible oversight by the designers. The handle should have been approximately centered over the battery. Even a shoulder strap coming off the battery area would have helped.
customer_reviews.author: Sun Hester

customer_reviews.title: Great unit but the one I bought one 2 years ago broke, this is the replacement
customer_reviews.text: Great power and portability, not terribly loud and convenient to stop and start on demand. The 80v battery lasts about 8-10 minutes at full power, which is probably unnecessary for most jobs. On a full charge I can completely blow the roof of my house and the back porch when used on medium power. The lower rating is due to reliability. Motor electronics stopped working on the one I bought two years ago, after expiration of warranty. I like the performance features enough that I bought the same one again, we'll see if they have fixed that.
customer_reviews.author: Mod MINI

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: I love being able to weed eat whenever I want and not have to deal with the frustration of gas-powered trimmer. This trimmer is not for thick brush. I use it when I trim at our local cemetery. I bought an extra battery and can do all the trimming without waiting for the battery to charge. But it does charge really fast. Love the leaf blower too, cleans off grass clippings with ease. I’ve only used the first and 2nd setting and it’s powerful.
customer_reviews.author: T. L. Reisinger

customer_reviews.title: Cannot recommend enough. The blower is the most powerful ive ...
customer_reviews.text: The time i saved mowing, weedeating, and blowing off everything are going to be well worth it over my gas and plug in past equipment. Cannot recommend enough. The blower is the most powerful ive ever used and ive used backpack blowers before. Not having to mess with gas and saving 10-20 minutes on jumping over cords these devices will pay for themselves in no time. Great great products!
customer_reviews.author: Joel

customer_reviews.title: Quietest string trimmer ever.
customer_reviews.text: Almost a pleasure trimming weeds with no noise! I replaced the string line trimmer head with a 3 steel blade brush cutter and what a difference, quite, smooth and fast. On a 2ah battery, I got 30 minutes plus cutting time. Weeds 3/4" in diameter were no match for this trimmer. The only negative is the trimmer needs a few seconds to come up to full speed but you get use to it very shortly. You do have to be extra careful using these steel blades but they definitely work great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Arndt

customer_reviews.title: MORE LIKE A GAS TRIMMER THAN A BATTERY TRIMMER
customer_reviews.text: IT'S A BIT LONG, IT'S A BIT HEAVY BUT IT HAS LOTS OF POWER. MORE LIKE A GAS TRIMMER THAN A BATTERY TRIMMER. IVE HAD 4 BATTERY TRIMMERS AND THIS ONE IS THE BEST, BATTERY LASTS LONG ENOUGH FOR ME TO TRIM FRONT AND BACK YARD AND STILL HAS POWER LEFT. I THINK THE 6O VOLT MODEL WOULD HAVE BEEN GOOD ENOUGH IF YOU DONT WANT TO SPEND $300, ITS ABOUT HALF THAT PRICE.
customer_reviews.author: JIM F

customer_reviews.title: Run time significantly shorter than described
customer_reviews.text: This was more expensive that we were initially planning on spending for a new blower, but we decided to buy this one based on the battery life (up to 70 minutes) and power mentioned in description. I was disappointed to find out that it lasts only up to 10 minutes before needing to recharge the battery. (We followed the directions for initial charge, etc., in the directions.) My husband called and spoke with someone about this, but was essentially told there was nothing that could be done. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Billy S

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, easy to load, well balanced
customer_reviews.text: good, powerful, versatile trimmer. Only drawback is likely an inherent feature of this style of motor, it takes a few seconds to "spin up" to speed, as opposed to the instant gratification of an AC or Gas powered unit. Been using this with one battery shared between three machines (chainsaw, trimmer, leaf blower) for about a year now.. no noticeable battery degradation... good purchase. String is MUCH easier to load than my previous electric unit... just precut, position in middle and twist to load...
customer_reviews.author: Royce Williams

customer_reviews.title: When it runs it does great
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this and the edger attachment attachment in September. When the motor runs, it does a great job with both attachments. However, much of the time, I cannot get it to run. It seems to have a problem with the main switch or more likely with the safety switch. I have called support multiple times, but all I get is I am 60+ in line to talk to an agent. I should have sent it back to exchange it, but now I guess it is too late. Unfortunately, Green Works, being out of Canada, does not have service in most of the US, including my area in Utah.
customer_reviews.author: SCATeam

customer_reviews.title: The Best For What I Need
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite toy. I have a yard guy who keeps the driveway and property looking great, but when I need to do a quick blow when company is coming, it's the greatest thing since sliced bread. I will say it is a bit heavy, and I do think they could shape the end of the blower better. It is round on the end and therefore "broadcasts" instead a more directed air burst. Still, I absolutely love it! The short battery life doesn't bother me, and it recharges very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Bee

customer_reviews.title: 18 months and still a great buy!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this unit for 18 months now. Our AZ home is all brick patio with a flat roof. Hubby blows the tree litter off the patio a couple times a month and blows off the roof and the gutters twice a year. This unit does a great job. Today we did the 2000 SF roof, all the gutters and had enough battery left to clean all the roof mess off the patios. It's light enough for me to use and hubby is very pleased with battery life and power.
customer_reviews.author: WyndWoman

customer_reviews.title: Extremely easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Extremely easy to assemble. There is some delay from when you pull the trigger to when it actually starts blowing air. It will sometimes stutter at the low RPM range but once it gets moving the high rpm action is fine. Having a lot of experience with R/C brushless motors and ESC's, it feels like the timing is off with the internal speed controller on this unit. It's not enough to take away any stars or not recommend it however, it goes great with the entire GreenWorks system.
customer_reviews.author: Terry M. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: So far in my short usage this is great!
customer_reviews.text: Has power, short charge time is 30 min. That in itself is nice eh! Well balanced, can change speeds on the fly by just pushing a button symbol. This is grand for my condo front deck and rear elevated deck with stairs. Not to forget I use it in my two rock-scapes. I did searches, comparisons for weeks and decided on this brand with 80 volt cordless. Pleased and happy with my purchase. Manufacturers warranty is long, meets my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Terre

customer_reviews.title: Running time is bad if use the highest blowing power option
customer_reviews.text: It looks nice, little bit heavy. The major problem is that a good blowing power is if you use the highest speed. Unfortunately in this scenario a battery die after 5-7 minutes. This is not enough even for a small project
customer_reviews.author: Customer Nick

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade from 40v!
customer_reviews.text: I went from using the Greenworks 40v mower to this and man I waited too long! I love the 21" deck as well, makes mowing much faster. I like the exercise of pushing the mower, but it is so lightweight and powerful that I don't miss having a self propelled mower except on small hills. The battery charger has a nice cooler on it and allows me to charge batteries after mowing, where before I had to wait for them to cool down much longer.
customer_reviews.author: TechTom

customer_reviews.title: Battery only runs 20 minutes.
customer_reviews.text: It works great but the battery only runs for 20 minutes. Wish it had a strap to go over your shoulder to make it easier to carry. I'm very surprised that, Greenworks, who makes it didn't think of this simple solution. My Toro electric blower has a great strap to help support you carrying it around the yard. I had to create and make my own strap. Greenworks would sell a lot more of this battery powered model if they created a carrying strap for it. Seems like their R and D department never used any common sense.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Brayton

customer_reviews.title: Battery issue
customer_reviews.text: Gave 3 stars because of battery issue. Had units for 1 month and the battery crapped out. I emailed the company and am still waiting on response. Was able to talk to someone in customer service and they did an excellent job of replacing the defective battery at no cost. Love the trimmer and blower just hope the battery issues don't continue.
customer_reviews.author: Doug

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product that provides the necessary power to blow large ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product that provides the necessary power to blow large piles of leaves and move wet leaves. At full power the battery lasts only about 20 minutes so that is the only downside. With 20 minutes of power, I can blow leaves into large piles and while it's charging again I can move the leaves to the curb. I might consider getting a second battery next season. Awesome blowing power and had no trouble with getting leaves pushed around. Multi speed for when I need less power for delicate yard areas or blowing dirt. Relatively quiet for how much power it puts out so no need for ear protection or driving the neighbors crazy. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: St. Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great trimmer
customer_reviews.text: I have had several gas-powered trimmers and have ruined several with ethanol gas. Not a problem with this trimmer. It also will connect with several other tools that I have with no problem. Does a fantastic job with thick grass and weeds around our pond. The battery charges rapidly. It is heavy and instructions say to use a strap with an illustration for a strap. I don't know if it was supposed to come with a strap, but mine did not have one included. I would give this a five star rating if it was supposed to come with a strap, and mine did not.
customer_reviews.author: jacog17

customer_reviews.title: Impressed.
customer_reviews.text: It's got the power to take down some fairly dense tall grass/weeds. It worked well for the first time I used it. It was cutting through all the grass or weed type vegetation. It took about 40 minutes before it overheated and shut down. I'm guessing if I took it easier going through the dense stuff that it might not have shut down so soon. The battery still had power though. Simple to use but a tad heavy overall to carry around for extended periods of time swinging back and forth. It's got more power than I do. lol
customer_reviews.author: J. Y.

customer_reviews.title: and works with all my attachments so my earlier investments are not wasted. I am very impressed by the power of ...
customer_reviews.text: Quiet, light, and works with all my attachments so my earlier investments are not wasted. I am very impressed by the power of this weed eater. It even comes with a shoulder strap which non of my previous gas motors did (that was extra!). I'm done with storing gas. done with mixing. done with 14 cranks while dorking with the choke. done with rubber gas buttons that always dry rot. done with spark plugs and ear plugs. Done with carb clean outs after winter storage. 30min battery charge and off I go. yea me!
customer_reviews.author: JR

customer_reviews.title: Quiet!!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this blower due to the quiet operation. In general I hate the noise of leaf blowers and have thus resisted getting one. However, this model is so quiet (particularly at the low setting) you don't need earplugs, don't bug your neighbors, etc. I find that it operates continuously for quite a while (an hour or so?) and recharging is very fast. My minor gripes: * About every 10th time starting it, it will seem to 'lock' as if some gears are at loggerheads. Pressing the trigger again always gets it going. * You have to press really hard to release the catch to remove the battery.
customer_reviews.author: cmajor9th

customer_reviews.title: Good Electric Blower but Had a Defective Unit
customer_reviews.text: The blower handles a .25 acre yard very well. I've used it on the yard, street, drive way, roof, and porch. It gets the job done. The original unit was defective and only lasted 4 to 5 months. Fortunately, I had a local service location 15 minutes from home and they returned the unit under the 1 yr warranty. It took about 10 weeks to get a replacement, which was frustrating as we were without a blower for all of Fall. I have a 2 and 4 amp battery. The 4 amp is definitely preferred when blowing the entire yard. The 2 amp won't last long enough. I'd still recommend this blower for a typical homeowner.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Short Run Time On Full Power
customer_reviews.text: To me the description pro means a product or a tool that is useful in the industry for professional use. Using the blower at full power means having about 20 minutes maximum blower time per battery. I have a very small home and a tiny yard and find myself having to switch batteries with every use. It would be nice if Green Works was more forthcoming with the description of run time off of their current product While being run on full power
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Did the Whole 1/3 Acre Yard on Small Battery
customer_reviews.text: We've probably all arrived here via a similar path - we started with a cheap gas trimmer, and eventually the carb gummed up. Or, we started with an 18V Ryobi which got us by. Do yourself a favor and start here, or upgrade when you can. This cut my trimming time down significantly vs the 18V Ryobi, and has way more power for two strings. I only had to bump feed it twice doing my 1/3 acre lawn. Keep in mind if you're upgrading from something less powerful, this will sling rocks at your shins if it digs in.
customer_reviews.author: chatham7

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use! Tech suppport almost impossible.
customer_reviews.text: I set the trimmer up as in the instructions, turned it in on and within six feet of use the spool and a metal casing flew off and hit me in the leg. I screwed the spool back on and now it doesn't run. I called tech support and it said I was number 203 in line with a wait time of approximately 4 hrs 32 minutes! Obviously, I'm not the only having issues with Greenworks. With no call back feature or response from my email, I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful! Battery power lasts REALLY long, I've only totally run it down once! Only complain is that one of the indicator lights no longer works. The unit is light weight and the charge lasts, it's heavy with the battery, but much more lighter than had powered and I hated the cord of plug in units! It used to take longer to rewind the cord than it did to blow.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Mergelkamp

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I've used this several times now. While the battery doesn't last to do the amount of weed whacking that I needed to do, it made me stop and take a break to get out of the heat and drink some water while it charged. I also have a greenworks mower so I alternate between the two while batteries are charging. I didn't want to deal with gas, and I didn't want to worry about hitting a cord so I went with battery operated trimmer, mower, and leaf blower. I plan on looking at other greenworks products in the future as I get settled into the new house.
customer_reviews.author: n c c

customer_reviews.title: If you are environment conscious this is a must have
customer_reviews.text: Using it for over 3 months now. Setup was very easy. Just insert the battery and the trimmer to the power head and you are ready to go. It has enough power. I am using craftsman's attachment. They work without any issue. It was a big deal for me as I didn't plan to buy other Greenworks attachments. On a 2.0 AH battery, it can last almost 1 hour or slightly more. I can use the edger, trimmer and blower in a single charge. I have a moderately large yard
customer_reviews.author: jaycha2

customer_reviews.title: Good blower similar to others in its class
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice blower, with that being said I had a 40 V Kobalt, that cost less and seem to have the same performance characteristics. I do not think this is a brushless motor and that may be part of the issue. The 80 V battery is somewhat heavy but the advantages it’s interchangeable with their cordless chainsaw. I’m not really a fan of the adjustable trigger throttle, it seems to have a very delayed response
customer_reviews.author: Gilley

customer_reviews.title: world's best customer service
customer_reviews.text: amazing, unbelievable customer service. My trimmer developed a fault after a year of great service. I was incredibly satisfied with the trimmer - very effective and powerful and easy to operate. Great string loading design. After talking to them on the phone when my trimmer developed a problem they offered to send me a replacement unit since there is no repair place anywhere near where I live. I will be a Greenworks customer for life now. I plan on buying more of their tools.
customer_reviews.author: wombat

customer_reviews.title: This pushes a lot of air and easily cleans the rocks and debris from my garage in ...
customer_reviews.text: So far this product is everything I was hoping for. This is my second battery powered blower, the first one was nearly 6 yrs. ago and was also a GreenWorks. This pushes a lot of air and easily cleans the rocks and debris from my garage in the time it would take to start my old blower from the past. Pine needles and leaves are no problem either. You might wonder why have different speeds, but when you are up against a wall sometimes its best to turn it down so stuffs not flying back at you. 80volts is at this time the most powerful, so purchase with confidence that this is not a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Birdman

customer_reviews.title: The low setting works great for this task
customer_reviews.text: I bought this blower to blow leaves off of my bark mulch. The low setting works great for this task. I love not having to drag around a cord or keep around a can of gas. It is quiet for this type of device. Balance was pretty good. Just a little bit of a lift, but it was a little heavy. I wish the power button had a lock. Holding the button down all the time gets tiring.
customer_reviews.author: JulieB

customer_reviews.title: Powerful blower
customer_reviews.text: This blower has plenty of power. I just used for the first time to blow wet maple leaves off my dirt/gravel driveway area and it worked very well. It has 3 power selections but the speed can be modulated via the trigger which was very useful. Had enough battery power to finish the job but left me with one power light remaining.
customer_reviews.author: Roy M.

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I had used ryobi outdoor products until I had an issue with a relatively new battery. Ryobi fought tooth and nail to make sure I did not get a replacement. They'd rather I just purchase a new battery that cost almost as much as the tool. So I went with Greenworks, I found their products performed better and had plenty of power. Recently a green works 80V battery would no longer charge and I was all set to go to battle again. Surprise! Their customer service contacted me within a day, reviewed the situation and they are sending me a new battery this week.
customer_reviews.author: robert mansfield

customer_reviews.title: Unstable handle after screwing tight
customer_reviews.text: Great product but not perfect in one aspect as far I’m concerned. The grip handle that’s provided to give you more control and balance holding the edger while cutting continue to move and twist even after tightening screws as much as possible; the handle continues to switch. Difficult especially when using add-on attachement and the equipment twist and turns while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Geno Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Pro Quality, But Room For Improvement
customer_reviews.text: This unit is the next level above all of those entry-level, “toy,” battery-powered weed whackers. The main reason we got this was because we already had the battery. The ergonomics are average, the materials it’s made with are average. It can rip through a lot more and a lot faster than cheaper models. I just wish it came with some replacement cartridge(s) or plastic thread...for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Poor run time
customer_reviews.text: The "detail" of the product on Amazon says up to to 70 min run time. Beware that the run time at high speed is less than 15 minutes. I bought this as a Christmas gift and the person just now used it. I am extremely unhappy with this blower because I had bought it with the notion that the "high" run time would be more than 10 to 15 minutes. Because it was bought more than 45 days ago there is no refund or return. Called the Mfg with my complaint but was rudely dismissed. Just know what your getting when you buy this blower!
customer_reviews.author: David Wright

customer_reviews.title: Must buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had bought this product sooner. Both has plenty of power and the battery last a good while.I did not write a review right away because I wanted to put it to the test. It received an A+ from me. This is a no brainier!!!! Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Piddlerdude

customer_reviews.title: The string head is terrible AND you CANNOT replace it.
customer_reviews.text: If you want to get a string trimmer where the line properly feeds through, and that you do not need to disassemble every 15 minutes to re-feed the line, you need to stay away from this one. We got so frustrated with this trimmer that we went out and purchased a new head. The problem is you CANNOT remove the head on this trimmer and replace it with one that actually works. Save yourself frustration and money and purchase a line trimmer that 1) works, and 2) if it doesn't, allows you to upgrade to something that actually does work. Ours is now in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: A3ON Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great by itself or with attachments
customer_reviews.text: Works very well with the attached string trimmer. But like most string trimmers the line does not come out as easy as it is advertising. But they all seem to have that problem. I use it with a 4 tip brushcutter attachments as well as an 8" chain pole saw, I also use a 7.5" edger, MTD blower, 22" hedger, & cultivator. Now to use it more with the string head. This trimmer seems to be more aggressive than any of the gas powered ones I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: heisetax

customer_reviews.title: It’s love!
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had the Toro 51619 that is a best seller here on Amazon for several years. It costs about a 100 bucks. I have been struggling with the power cord and awkward design of the toro and it causes me to be reluctant to take out the leaf blower. Let me tell you, this thing is easily worth the extra $100 over the corded Toro. Power is less, but it’s still ample. Battery strength is good. What a difference! The design is great and easy to use and you don’t have to break out the extension cord every time. I think I’m in love!
customer_reviews.author: DDSW

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff. Works with 80V Max Kobalt batteries with slight modification.
customer_reviews.text: It's very powerful & relatively quiet. You still get the numb fingers after a while. I modified the battery housing so it would work with my Kobalt 6Ah Max 80V battery. Same battery with a tiny difference in the slide channels. You could whack a whole golf course with this battery/trimmer combo.
customer_reviews.author: esteban

customer_reviews.title: 20 minute battery life
customer_reviews.text: Not happy that battery only lasts 20 minutes with leaf blower on constant high speed. It takes 30-35 minutes to charge the battery. Even with an extra battery I will be "down" for 10-15 minutes to blow leaves off the lawn. Three recharges each for front and back lawn of an average size yard = 2 hrs run time and 2 hrs wait time.. not good. Probably will get a 2.0 A-H additional battery because the 4.0 A-H battery at $250 is 2.3X the cost of 2.0 AH. Not the value and time effective proposition I thought it would be. Blower itself works well to blow somewhat wet leaves. Much less noise than 2 cycle gas blower.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory F. Exner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome leaf blower
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower is fantastic its lighter than gas-powered leaf blowers I think even on turbo power it blows stronger. This comes with a battery and charger. This is a great product for women and seniors easy to use just turn it on and pull the trigger. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Rose.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool combo for my small property
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with a steep 30 yd driveway with lots of trees in the front and a small patch of grass with garden beds around the perimeter fence in the back. The blower keeps the driveway clear and not slippery with leaves and the trimmer can handle the grass by the road, at the edge of the driveway, and in the back all in about half a battery charge. I'm already planning on getting some other Greenworks tools for some landscaping updates!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and very portable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to blow leaves from my second story deck where I didn't want to lug my large back-pack blower. I was skeptical of a battery powered blower but I am really impressed. It is light and super easy to use. I enjoyed it so much I started blowing off my driveway and it was great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who is tired of carrying around a heavy blower.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: This is a great product!
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the battery run-time and charge time. I originally bought this thinking they shared batteries with the Kobalt that looks exactly the same, just the case it just enough different that they are not interchangeable. Nevertheless I really like this product and it works great and has great blowing power. It charges up quickly in 30 min and has great runtime for this blower.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond D Jennings Jr

customer_reviews.title: Seems heavier than my Husky gas model.
customer_reviews.text: I like using cordless yard tools now. My Greenworks mower is much lighter and easier to use than my gas mower. I like it very much. The new cordless line trimmer was a bit disappointing as it seems just as heavy as my old gas trimmer. It works very well though and seems well built.
customer_reviews.author: Felix Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Product is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I now own 3 green works tools and absolutely love them. This trimmer has plenty of power and lightweight. My brother who does landscaping for a living tried it and was very impressed. I am tired of storing gas, mixing gas with oil, and hate the fuel smell when using gas powered tools. I am trying to convert over to battery operated equipment and GreenWorks makes very good battery operated tools.
customer_reviews.author: Teebow

customer_reviews.title: Works great, blows very strong!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for what I want it for! I use it to blow dirt and dust out of my garage and my driveway. SUPER strong! I feel like it's stronger than the craftsman WIRED blower that I had. There's 3 fan settings next to the power button, and the trigger to push down is also variable speed, so if you push the trigger lightly it blows lighter. One of the cons is this cost be a good chunk of change and didn't come with a battery for itself. LUCKILY, I have a 5aH battery and a 2aH battery that i received with my trimmer and my lawnmower.
customer_reviews.author: Norman D

customer_reviews.title: 3rd Green Works tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. Pull the trigger and it works. My trimming lasts about an hour at a time and I have not had an issue with battery life yet
customer_reviews.author: RBL

customer_reviews.title: Just right for me
customer_reviews.text: This is just right for me. I didn’t want anything heavy, so I went for the 2Ah, and yes it does run out of juice depending on the speed choices (of three) I make, but it recharges quickly, and by the time I have a certain area bagged it’s ready to go for the next. It blows the leaves off of my pavement and it also will pile leaves that are on the grass if they are not wet, plus It moves them very nicely out of the flowerbeds onto the grass.
customer_reviews.author: Gail F. Adamson

customer_reviews.title: Option for purchase are misleading
customer_reviews.text: The $119 trimmer does NOT come with a battery or charger. Even though when you select the option to purchase it says “battery & charger (attachment capable) “ It’s another $200+ for the battery. I’ll be returning this as spending $320+ on a weed trimmer is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Eye

customer_reviews.title: Defective Battery
customer_reviews.text: I have contacted Greenworks and am hoping that they will replace the defective battery. That said, it is concerning that upon opening, the battery is defective. I am wondering how common this is. Was really bummed as I had been looking forward to using it due to all the positive reviews. I will update if I get a new battery and am able to use.
customer_reviews.author: M Dye

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: I settled on Greenworks tools because of the generally good reviews and they look well-established on Amazon. I bought 4 of the 40V tools and this 80V blower. I used it a year no problem and then it quit on me. The Customer Service Rep was terrific in trying to get my unit back in working order but when that was unsuccessful, they sent me a new unit. GREAT Customer Service, which is always a concern for online purchases...
customer_reviews.author: Mark E. Alcamo

customer_reviews.title: Great combo at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this combo for a year and normally I can trim the whole yard and blow the sidewalks and drive on a single charge. Very powerful and quiet trimmer that lasts a long time. Blower works admirably althouth on highest setting runs the battery down quickly.
customer_reviews.author: M. Peery

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: After my last gas blower died in a way that was more expensive to repair than it was worth I decided to give this a try. Very pleased with it. Battery run times have been quite good and so far more than enough for the way we use this around the home. It's quieter than the gas blower, and far easier to use. My wife would rarely use the gas blower (she hated it - complained that it made her hands feel numb after a while) but I find her using this one frequently.
customer_reviews.author: G. Mickle

customer_reviews.title: good machine, much more powerful than my previous corded ...
customer_reviews.text: good machine, much more powerful than my previous corded version. Run time is just about adequate to blow our rather large yard (about 1/3 of an acre) with copiously producing deciduous trees (Box Elder, Maple, Apple, Pear) The spring that ejects the battery could be a little stronger, 6 or 7 months in the battery has started sticking when I try to remove for charging, resulting in some interesting gymnastics on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Williams

customer_reviews.title: Very good power, but toy-like build
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a few months and the force of the blower is impressive. Can only rate it 2 stars, however, because of the cheap construction. It's all lightweight plastic, and the "clip" mechanism that is supposed to lock/release the battery is already broken. The battery snaps in, releases on it's own, then pops out. Seriously, the plastic on my grand kids toys is heavier duty than this.
customer_reviews.author: MrsEd

customer_reviews.title: Great tool in the 80V greenworks line-up
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. Easily as powerful as a gas powered unit. Simple design with a variable speed trigger and 3 power levels. Easy in/out with the 80V battery that can be shared with other tools in the line. Very powerful and good run time. ~40 minutes of continual use on a 2ah battery. With the fast 30 minute re-charge time you cold have infinite run time with only two batteries. This is a real tool and not some "eco-warrior" green gimmick. Highly recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Flemjasmo

customer_reviews.title: Only negative feature is stringing the thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this series of products. I love their warranty support. I enjoy the attachment capabilities with other competitors attachments as well.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Awkward, horrible balance. Return
customer_reviews.text: Horrible to hold. Battery is heaviest part and located all the way in back (the rest is hollow plastic tubing). So the entire time you blow- you have to fight the weight of it. No auto setting- must hold trigger or make your own. Returned and purchased backpack version for 30$ more— it’s a much better unit.
customer_reviews.author: Lakkiada

customer_reviews.title: Good value and good product so far!
customer_reviews.text: Finally cut the cord on my blower and trimmer. Got the 80 Volt so a bit longer life and more powerful. Think this blower at its high setting is more powerful than my old electric blower. Much less weight and more balanced as I am not having to account for the cord all the time. Much easier to use. Trimmer did what it was supposed to do and has a nice balance as well! If you are considering cutting the cord this is a good option. I do not have a big lawn and it does not take me more than 15 minutes to get either trimming the lawn or blowing out debris.
customer_reviews.author: James Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: 1st day od using the 80v blower, i have a 25cc 170mph 390cfm weed eater gas blower and the new greenworks is alot more powerful. I am super impressed so far but will see how the battery holds out throughout the season. I have the 80v mower, trimmer, and blower now and all are working great.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yards acre or less. Very quiet would be great for cities.
customer_reviews.text: We love it. We use it all around the house and pool and privacy fence. The weed eater seems to use up less battery than the blower but where we use it one battery finishes the job for both. We are thinking of getting the push mower and the chainsaw
customer_reviews.author: Jason Scott Smith

customer_reviews.title: Powerful but short battery life
customer_reviews.text: I really like this And am impressed with the power and ease of use . The only “minus” is that the included battery lasts only 20-30 minutes . It does charge quickly , but you still have to stop and wait. I did order and additional 4.0 battery that will hopefully last longer , but that is another $200+
customer_reviews.author: Kari Rickman

customer_reviews.title: Quiet Powerful Force
customer_reviews.text: This leaf blower has a strong air stream yet gentile on your ears. I bought an extra battery a little pricy but well worth the money. I live on a 1/3 acre property and we have many large trees Oak, Maple. and such so it takes me about 1/2 hour to do our back yard and 1/2 hour to do the front and side yard. 1 battery last about 40 mins on 2nd setting or 30 min full bore. This beats gas blowers and electric my latest toy. JZ 74years and enjoying life!
customer_reviews.author: John Z. Westbury NY

product_meta.title: Greenworks Pro 80V Cordless Brushless Axial Blower, 2.0Ah Battery and Rapid Charger Included
product_meta.description: Size:2.0Ah Battery and Charger| Style:Blower| Pattern Name:BlowerGreen works is starting a revolution in outdoor power equipment starting with its green works pro 80V li-ion Max system. combined with our DigiPro Brushless motor, this is the highest voltage, gas equivalent, commercial grade cordless outdoor power tool system in the industry. featuring the simple electric start, light weight designs & quieter motor, professionals & heavy DIY'ers can now tackle tough jobs through variable terrain without the hassle of gas, fumes, heavy gear or delicate maintenance needs of gas powered engines. the evolution of green works lithium-ion technology & designs have made it possible for professionals to get their jobs done by simply snapping in a battery & pressing a button while delivering high performance power & longer run time to get the job done. green works pro 80V li-ion Max system features a jet blower, 18" chainsaw, hedge trimmer, string trimmer, lawn mower. with green works, we understand that it's not just a tool. It's your life.
feature_bullets: Greenworks Pro 80V brushless axial blower provides up to 70 minutes run-time on speed 1 (low) / 28 minutes run-time on speed 2 (medium) / 12 minutes run-time on speed 3 (high) with fully charged 2Ah battery
Brushless motor provides more torque, quiet operation, and longer life. Gas equivalent performance

Axial blower features 125 mph / 500 cfm performance, 3 speed options, variable speed trigger, and cushioned overmold grip. Rated at only 60 decibels, it is perfect for neighborhoods and corporate parks with noise ordinances
80V 2Ah battery and rapid charger included (charges in only 30 minutes)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,798 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
